column4: anyone knows how to add mounted iso's to the synaptic's packet manager???
try "man apt-cdrom" it should tell you.
sudo mkdir /media/iso0 ;sudo mount <path to your iso> /media/iso0 ;sudo apt-cdrom <aproprate info>
it's pretty easy as an iso also.   just mount the iso and point apt-cdrom at it.....
I did exactly what you told me
what is the name and path of the iso file?  i'll write you a line you can paste in a terminal to mount it.
ls your mount point to make sure it is mounted.
i can't type the command for you as concerning apt-cdrom, i don't use ubuntu or debian so i don't have the apt syntax memorized.  sorry.
it will be something like "apt-cdrom add -m /media/iso0 "
open the Term and type "sudo apt-config " (might hit the tab key to make sure it is not configure) and the bottom line "edit <blah>" and comment out the first line.
can i ask if you are on dialup or is there some reason not to use the online sources ?
in portugal we have download limit, and if I downloaded that I would have to use 1/4 of our monthly downloads!
